direction.raw_text: DOWN lower and lower until we see the terrain below... the desert.  There is no vegetation whatever, just sand and odd-shaped rock formations.  The air is filled with red dust, which alternately obscures and then reveals the image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: optically - enlarging the film grain in the process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a barren landscape, once more with bizarre rocks.  Dust.  Sound of wind.  CAMERA MOVES FORWARD again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but this time, in the distance are some enormous plastic domes.  Sunlight striking them and reflect- ing causes brilliant rainbows.  CAMERA optically tracks toward the dome, seen in tantalizingly indistinct fashion through the red dust.  DISSOLVE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , and, in the distance, on the horizon of the arid landscape is a huge SPHINX-LIKE STRUCTURE.  (It is reminiscent of the Egyptian sphinx, but both body and face, though gargoyle-like, are different in design.)  There are some large pyramids not far from the sphinx.  CAMERA MOVES optically FORWARD.  DISSOLVE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is much closer to the sphinx and is directly in front. It moves (combination of zoom and optical printer move) towards the eyes, which appear to be red gems. As CAMERA APPROACHES one of the eyes, it appears to be stained red glass, as in a temple.  Suddenly there is a terrific explosion and the glass shatters into millions of fragments which hurtle toward the camera... 2       INT. CATACOMB BELOW "SPHINX" - DAY A MAN wearing a LIGHTWEIGHT THERMAL SUIT is RUNNING THROUGH THIS LABYRINTH of TUNNELS.  The GROUND TREMBLES under him, as if in an earthquake.  We cannot clearly make out his face, especially since he wears some kind of BREATHING APPARATUS over a portion of it. The surface of the tunnel's "walls" is curious;  the walls are, again, bright reddish orange, and a composite of two different substances:  rough-textured, clay-like material and red quartz, which glistens like crystal. The man throws a backward glance over his shoulder, fear- fully, as he runs.  His HANDS are SPLATTERED with BLOOD. Because of this, the RED GLOW, the air of FEAR to the man, and the GROUND HEAVING and BUCKLING, there is almost a
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: SEE HANDS REACHING OUT OF THE LIGHT TOWARDS US
result.heading: SEE HANDS REACHING OUT OF THE LIGHT TOWARDS US

direction.raw_text: suggestion to the scene. Suddenly, up AHEAD of the man, there appears a BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT.  He SEES IT, and runs even faster towards it. We are ALMOST UP TO THE LIGHT, and we SEE HANDS REACHING OUT OF THE LIGHT TOWARDS US... that seem to beckon him to
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ENTIRE SCREEN GOES RED, BUT IN REVERSE NEGATIVE

direction.raw_text: the ENTIRE SCREEN GOES RED, BUT IN REVERSE NEGATIVE; with YELLOW LAYOVERS.  (So that all the images we see -- ENTIRE FRAME -- are small YELLOW AREAS diffused on a RED BACKGROUND.)  It is much like looking at a tableau made out of molten lava.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 3       INT. BEDROOM IN SMALL APARTMENT - MORNING DOUGLAS QUAIL and his wife KRISTEN, are asleep in bed. Gradually the room lights BRIGHTEN.  The CLOCK CHIMES and begins SPEAKING in a soft, feminine voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tick, tock, seven o'clock.  Time to rise and open your eyes. They don't budge.  Shortly, the clock CHIMES again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tick, tock, seven-oh-one.  Time to get up, the day had begun. Quail's wife stirs.  Maddeningly, the clock CHIMES a third time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tick, tock -- Quail reaches out and shuts the clock off.  Then he sits up in bed. He swings his legs out from under the covers and sits on the edge of the bed.  He puts on his glasses and sits, lost  in thought. He is a good-looking but conventional man in his early thirties.  He seems rather in awe of his wife, who is attractive and rather off-hand towards him. Kirsten pulls on her robe, lights a cigarette, sits fishing for her slippers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dreamed about Mars again... it was bizarre, yet is was so real...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your time of the month again. Quail looks at her quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least once a month.  Douglas Quail's obsession.  For twelve years you've been talking about Mars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People do go to Mars, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Douglas.  But not you.  Not us. Quail looks crestfallen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it is, we can barely scrape by on your lousy ten thousand a week. She leaves the room.  He meditates on what she said, depressed. 4       INT. KITCHENETTE - MORNING Quail and Kirsten sit at a small table, eating breakfast. On the WALL is projected the front page of a NEWSPAPER. Drinking his coffee, Quail studies the wall with the air of a man who had his "node stuck in a newspaper," ignoring his wife. The newspaper headline reads:  "RIOTING ON MARS OVER WATER TAX." His wife is reading a different article:  "Four Women Rape Man in Park."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do they expect ... the way men dress these days ... then they scream rape. Quail is absorbed in his own paper and doesn't hear her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know -- let's really do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rape men in the park?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Go to Mars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can pool our savings and I've got some sick leave coming, besides my regular vacation...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...more of a half-wit.  For a start a war could break out there any day ... She gestures toward the TV screen where Martian police are keeping protesters behind a barrier.  Some have signs reading "A FREE MARS", "DOWN WITH COHAAGEN", "EARTH - OUT" etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just media talk.  They're... (indicating the protesters) ...just a minority.  They're powerless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's a lot of things we need around here before we waste our money on a trip to Mars.  We're broke.  I'm just a slave around this dump. Now if you were capable of finding a better job.... The kitchen clock chimes and talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's now eight.  You'll be late!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be late! He jumps up quickly from the table, picks up his coat and briefcase, kisses KIRSTEN's perfunctorily offered cheek and leaves. 4A      EXT. CITY - EARLY MORNING CAMERA TRACKS with Quail as he walks along the busy modern street towards a subway station.  Modern cars (out of focus) pass noiselessly between the camera and Quail.  There is a plaintive tune being played on violin.  Quail pauses and gives a wad of notes to the aged violinist, then walks on briskly. 5       INT. SUBWAY STATION - EARLY MORNING Quail enters the station.  Everybody must pass through a weapons check before proceeding to the platforms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stand at either side, as commuters pass through an electronic beam.  On a screen, the entire body of each person is seen in X-ray.  All of them are clearly carrying a gun in their inside coat pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No weapon again, Mr. Quail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep forgetting, Herb.  They frighten me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Well, it's the law, Mr. Quail.  Has been since
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: they tell me.  Tomorrow - ya carry ya gun or ya get reported.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gestures to his associate.  They've obviously been through this with Quail before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Herb, okay. Quail walks on to the track area.  The train arrives. Signs above each approaching car say "CAR FULL", "ROOM FOR 10 PERSONS", etc.  Quail goes to a carriage marked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 6       INT. URBAN TRANSIT TRAIN - DAY The doors open and the crowd surges on.  Quail grabs a seat.  At intervals throughout the car are VIDEO MONITORS on which a NEWS BROADCAST is showing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: more violence today from Mars's strike-torn ore colonies -- Everyone ignores the broadcast -- except Quail, who perks instantly at the word "Mars." The NEWSCASTER is a young black man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but Earth Intelligence Operations Director Vilos Cohaagen, clearly worried about the damage to Mars's all important tourist industry was today dismissive of the dissident groups....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scene switches to a press conference.  COHAAGEN, sur- rounded by AIDES, steps in front of a podium packed with news network microphones and cameras.  Cohaagen is a striking, intense man with an obvious air of power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're dealing with a bunch of extremists and unrepresentative lunatics.  Mars is a happy and prosperous protectorate of Earth... and will remain so. The train stops at another station and more people pile on. Quail tries to watch the broadcast through the bodies passing in front of him and intermittently blocking the image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There have been some criticisms, sir....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no further comment. The news conference ends and a bright looking young man comes on the screen.  Quail continues to watch, though not as interested, initially, as he was by the Mars story. Few of the other passengers bother looking at the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, commuters.  This portion of your trip is brought to you by Rekall, Inc.  Do you have a dream that never came true?  Do you aspire - but only perspire?  Has the great adventure passed you by?  Then come to... REKALL, where what might have been will have been. For the memories of a lifetime... REKALL. Quail watches the commercial through to the end, but doesn't seem to take it very seriously.  He glances away as a card comes on the screen with REKALL's numbers. 6B      INT. QUAIL'S OFFICE - DAY Quail is seated at a computer console in a vast beehive of a room.  Numerous people are typing information onto the screens.  Quail pauses in his typing, thoughtful.  He then types in a little more information, then pauses again. On the screen, a sentence types itself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?  REQUEST MORE INFORMATION. Quail read it and continues. 9       INT. McCLANE'S OFFICE - REKALL - DAY Scene opens on a CU of McCLANE, a genial, bubbling, enthus- iastic man. McCLANE We're all dreamers, Douglas. But here at Rekall, dreams are our business. He presses a button on his desk and the chairs on which they are seated appear to be in outer space.  Countless stars glitter all around.  Startlingly, a comet whizzes by. Quail is amazed.  McClane grins and presses the button again.  The scene changes to a beautiful underwater coral reef.  Multi-colored fish swim around the chairs and desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But... is the process really that effective?  A false memory!? McCLANE (shaking his head; smiling) We prefer the term "extra- factual implant".  Your memory will be complete in every way.  You will have gone to Mars.  We guarantee that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it in any way dangerous? I mean, the medical techniques? McCLANE Not when you deal with qualified operators - like us. He presses the button again and the normal office returns. Quail looks around, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just - incredible. McCLANE And look at our follow-up program! He puts items on the desk as he talks. McCLANE (continuing) Space-flight ticket stub... passport... vaccination certificates... matchbooks from Martian Nouvelle Cuisine Restaurants, souvenirs, post cards... even names of people you met - now back there - who you can call and discuss your trip with... by the way, we plant these things where you'll come across them at random in the future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But... I'll know I hired you. That'll destroy the whole illusion. McCLANE (smiling; self- satisfied) But you won't remember me, or having been here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't? McCLANE Your money back if you do! We've never paid out yet. Quail slumps backs in his chair, overwhelmed. McCLANE (continuing) And we have a special this month, for only two-hundred thousand dollars more. At the press of a button, a list appears on the wall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCLANE (continuing) You can have a new identity for the duration of the trip. Pick one. Quail's eyes linger on "Intelligence Agent."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Intelligence Agent"... wouldn't that be dangerous?  I might attack.... McCLANE (airily) No.  No.  You're a retired agent.  Mars was your last mission and you're never to break your cover.  But you'll have got the girl, killed the baddies, and saved the Universe.  Not bad, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... about the whole thing... it's all such a fake.  I won't really have gone.  I won't really.... McCLANE (kind but firm) Let's face it, Douglas, you, and millions of people like you have no chance of ever getting to Mars and you'd never qualify as a secret agent for EIO.  This - REKALL - is the only way to achieve your dream. He gets up and walks around to Quail's chair. McCLANE (continuing) Think about it, Douglas. Think, too, what a terrible boor a real holiday is. Lost tickets, endless arguments, lousy hotels, missed connections, rotten weather... Rekall will supply you with perfect, happy memories. Quail is thoughtful, willing to be totally convinced. 9A      INT. QUAIL'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Quail is sitting, distracted, in an uncomfortable modern chair.  Kirsten is watching a near-pornographic film on
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A14 MILLIONAIRE PLAYBOY A15 SPORTS HERO A16 INDUSTRIAL TYCOON A17 INTELLIGENCE AGENT

direction.raw_text: .  She casually lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that's illegal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Who's going to report me?  You?... wimp.... She watches a torrid love scene on the video.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screwing around's illegal, too.  But just give me half a chance... Quail looks at her with distaste.  His expression changes to one of resolve. 10      INT. MEMORY STUDIO - DAY Quail is stretched out on a plush reclining couch, alongside some strange-looking lab equipment, wearing a hospital-type smock.  In the b.g. hovers a TECHNICIAN, adjusting some instrumentation (discreet banks of computers, etc.) -- that apparently relates to the lab equipment next to Quail.  The room in a dim, soothing booth, lit by indirect lighting. Quail looks a little concerned as he studies all the instrumentation next to him -- as one always does at the dentist's, looking at the drills. The door opens abruptly, in walks a cute-looking LITTLE OLD LADY, wearing a JOGGING SUIT.  (A RUTH GORDON-TYPE.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, I'm Doctor Sophie Lull. Sorry I'm late. (walks toward coat closet) I'll be right with you. She dons a white medical smock that covers her jogging suit, then slings on heavy, lead-lined protective vest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This really going to work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It the Pope Martian? Lull's assistant, the TECHNICIAN in b.g., who had been steadily working on the instrumentation, now looks over at Lull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- that's it. Now, Lull extends a long rubber tube, a hypodermic needle attached to it.  Quail eyes it warily.  She swabs the back of his hand in preparation, notices his apprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, just relax, kid.  This ain't gonna hurt.  Just a controlled drip of Narkadine. When you're under, I'll just ask ya a few questions, nothin' real personal, just full details of yer private life so's we can tailor the wish-fulfillment program to your needs. She injects the needle into his hand as she speaks, tapes it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See?  Painless.  I didn't feel a thing.  Hey, you're a nice kid... you like a little somethin' extra? Quail, embarrassed, starting to go under, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good!  Kid -- have I got a girl for you!  She's gonna like you.  You're good-lookin'. (beat) Gettin' sleepy? (he nods) Good.  Now, what's the first thing you think of when you're thinkin' about Mars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I'd like to see the Martian Sphinx...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- you will, Dougle!  I want ya to start counting backwards from a hundred for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hundred... ninety-nine... ninety-eight... ninety-seven... ninety-six... ninety-five.... His voice drops off; his eyes close.  Lull studies him, adjusts some instruments, then turns to Ernie, glancing briefly at a typed sheet in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Ernie, the trip to Mars; number sixty-two... and throw in that blonde... We'll give him a real good time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixty-two... and... the blonde... He takes two discs and inserts the first one into a machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, is this one wild.  He won't want to come back. Ernie inserts the second disk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dougie?  This Sophie Lull. Can ya hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sophie....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good! ... I'm gonna ask ya a few more questions now.  Ya think you'll be able to answer 'em?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attaboy!  To begin with, I wanna ask ya; -- You sex life.  How many orgasms a week? 11      INT. McCLANE'S OFFICE - DAY McClane has several file drawers open and is removing diverse objects and placing them on his desk. These items apparently are objects Rekall, Inc. intends to "plant" for some client of theirs to find (perhaps even Quail) -- as part of his fantasy. While he is putting these things on his desk, the PHONE BUZZES.  He answers it. McCLANE Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howie?  Listen, you'd better get in here. McCLANE (not too concerned) Not another schizoid embolism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better get in here. 12      INT. MEMORY STUDIO - DAY McClane come quickly in, brushing the swinging door open. Lull and Ernie look up as he enters.  Quail lies on the couch, breathing slowly and regularly, his eyes closed. McClane looks queryingly at Lull, who motions him to silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quail?  Dougie, can you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell McClane what you told us. McClane glances sharply at Lull, then turns to Quail. Quail's eyes open and scan the room.  They settle on McClane.  These eyes have changed:  they have become cold and steely.  In fact, Quail's entire personality seems to have changed -- his face has acquired a flint- edged hardness.  He is chillingly menacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of you in this room are dead. McCLANE (not quite taking it seriously) What's he talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've broken my cover. McCLANE What is this?... McClane's eyes flash angrily at Lull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Narkadine cracked a memory cap.  Mars -- (she's scared) He's really been there. There is a chilly silence in the room as McClane digests this. McCLANE Forced suppression?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With spontaneous breakthrough. McCLANE Holy shit. They stare at Quail as if he's a ticking bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've compromised the Sphinx Project.  You'll have to be silenced. Now they're all panicked. McCLANE Wait a minute.  Quail -- QUAIL My name isn't Quail. McCLANE Listen... whoever you are... sir.... (almost pleading) ...This is all an accident. We'll destroy all the records. No one will know.  I swear it. Believe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you, but that won't stop E.T.O. from killing you. The Rekall people stare at each other in quiet horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Killing you... killing you... killing you.... His voice trails off, his eyes close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants a false memory implanted -- of a trip he really took. (pause) Someone at Earth Intelligence Operations erased his memory. All he know was going to Mars meant something special to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do?  Graft a false memory pattern over the real memory of the same thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-uh... That could promote a partial breakthrough of the real trip. McCLANE (overlapping) Revive him without any false memory implantation and get him out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we just wipe out the memory of his visit here? McCLANE (nodding; relieved) Yes.  Good.  I'll destroy his file and cancel his fee. I have a feeling that the longer he doesn't know who he is, where he's been, where he's going and who we are, the better off we'll all be.  I'm taking a holiday. A real one. He leaves.  The others stare after him, looking very grim. 12A     INT. RECEPTION AREA OF REKALL - DAY A dazed and disoriented Douglas Quail comes out of an inner door and walks through the lobby towards the exit door. An attractive RECEPTIONIST, her bare breasts visible through a clear plastic blouse, watches him; she then looks toward McClane who has half-opened the door to view Quail's progress. 12B     INT. ELEVATOR - DAY Quail travels down.  Uncomprehendingly, he looks out at the city. 12C     INT. BUILDING FOYER - DAY Quail stumbles through the fairly crowded foyer, oblivious to anything around him.  A red-headed man may or may not be watching him.  He makes a phone call from a pocket phone. 12D     INT. ROBOT TAXI CAB - AFTERNOON Scene open on Quail, in the back of the cab; he looks around, slowly coming to his senses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travelling south along Third Avenue, passing Fourty-third street. Although the driver's voice is a little mechanical (flat in tone) he is filmed from Quail's POV, and it isn't obvious he is anything other than an ordinary cab driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where am I going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-three thirteen "G" Street, Sector "L", Twin Towers, Apartment six-thirty- five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did I get here? Camera now cuts to a shot in front of the driver.  He is a fairly human-like robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don not understand the question, sir or madam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did I get into this cab?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stepped into it in the normal manner, sir or madam. 15      INT. CORRIDOR OF QUAIL'S APARTMENT - DAY The reception area and hallway leading to the elevators is smart and clean, though not lavish.  A uniformed and armed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing by the entrance door. Filmed from the elevator end of the area, we see the cab pull up and Quail alight and enter the building.  He nods to the doorman and approaches the elevators.  As he reaches them a MAN steps out from behind the camera.  A 2ND MAN enters from a door opposite the elevators.  Quail looks at them and becomes quite panicky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you the man from Mars? He takes a modern, lethal gun from his pocket.  Quail turns, but the other man is behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't give us a reason to kill you. Quail looks toward the doorman, who is paying little attention to the events.  As the two men edge Quail towards the door, he call out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Zimmer...Mr. Zimmer... help me... they're... But the doorman turns calmly away. 16      INT. BASEMENT CAR PARK - DAY The two men lead Quail past a number of cars to their own vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you taking me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told everyone at Rekall about you trip to Mars. Where you went, who you worked for, what you did -- QUAIL But I didn't... Are you telling me... I did go to Mars?  I don't remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've remembered too much. The Sphinx Project, for a start....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sphinx?... No, no, I don't, I... What about the people at Rekall?  I don't recall Rekall but you said if they know what I did?  Why don't you ask them?  They'll tell you I didn't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've been taken care of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Neither man bothers answering.  They arrive at their car and open the door for Quail.  He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the car. He slaps Quail hard across the face.  Quail is terrified. He is tearful with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God!  No!  You're going to kill me! He cringes.  His hands across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's going to kill you if [you do what you're told.] We're visiting E.I.O. for some new tests.  Now get in, or do we start playing rough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  It's not my fault!  You can't do it! They start to force him into the car physically. Suddenly, Quail stops cringing.  the FEAR DISAPPEARS FROM HIS FACE, and is replaced by an odd, thoughtful expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute, I remember -- 1ST AGENT What, Quail?  What do you remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Mars... they tried to kill me... And....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In an instant, he karate-chops both agents across the windpipe, and they crumple to the ground. Quail steps back.  He stares at the two bodies, incredulous; then stares at his own deadly HANDS.  It is as though they belong to someone else. Then, leaving the two agents sprawled across the alley, he races back into the basement door of his building. 18      INT. QUAIL'S APARTMENT - EVENING Kirsten is watching another pornographic video when Quail bursts in.  He is still disoriented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know I've been to Mars? Kirsten gets up and turns off the movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!  This stupid obsess...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've been.  I vaguely recall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug, you've got to forget...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget?  Remembering is the problem I must've been to one of those artificial memory places...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But something went wrong... something about a real memory... and then those men...  tried to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What men?  Doug, you're crazy. She starts to mix a drink from a well-stocked cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here now.  They didn't kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  That's what's so amazing. I killed them.  I think... Kirsten stops pouring her drink and look at him sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?  Where are they? Quail points down with his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug!  It's something they put into your mind at the memory place.  Fantasies. That's their business. She sips her drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no Garden of Eden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Quite a bit to see, though. The canyons, the old Sphinx...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much, really.  Millions of years old.  Bit like the one that used to be in Egypt, you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Got destroyed in the Arab wars... What about this independence movement?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not worth worrying about. Mostly descendants of the original colonists from Earth. Now they want self-rule so they can sell us all the minerals... I don't think we've met.  You with our group?  Takes me a while to know everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  Douglas Quail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Toltz. (they shake hands) Well, Doug, I hope we'll see a lot more of each other. 55      EXT. CITY (UNDER THE DOOM) - DAY The bus pulls up outside a modern tourist hotel.  The buildings surrounding it have a much more improvised, temporary look.  Most are pre-fabricated structures. The streets are crowded and there is a "frontier-town" atmosphere.  Stalls sell fruit and vegetables, also water and air containers. A lot of greenery is evident - this is to absorb CO2 and emit oxygen, thus helping with the air supply under the dome. Some small, ragged boys look at QUAIL as he looks around before going inside the hotel.  Suddenly, one of them throws a small sack at him.  It hits his chest and leaves a yellow stain.  The hotel DOORMAN chases the boys away....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smogpsucker! From the other side of the street, a gang of URCHINS with a harmonica start singing some kind of defiant PATRIOTIC SONG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how it is, sir.  Some of these red-asses are a bit prejudiced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prejudiced?  Against what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earthmen. The street song has swelled, adult MINERS and CITIZENS joining the belligerent chorus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they singing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Martian National Anthem. Quail tips the doorman, enter the hotel. 57      INT. MARS HILTON LOBBY - DAY Quail passes several kiosks -- a magazine stand, currency exchange, clothing store, shoeshine stand.  A SHOESHINE BOY looks up at Quail. Quail walks past, enters the main lobby.  The atrium entryway is absolutely fabulous; a complete contrast to the dirty, Casbah-like streets.  AFFLUENT-LOOKING PEOPLE in spotless linen fill the lobby. Quail stops to examine a large ROTATING DISPLAY sitting on a table in the middle of the lobby.  It is a stand-up model of a SPHINX.  Across the top is written "THE FIRST WONDER OF MARS".  A recorded VOICE repeats a canned speech -- CANNED VOICE "...the Martian Sphinx... only evidence of non-human civilization ever discovered ...age estimated at over eighteen million years...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at Quail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quail approaches the Registration Desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to have you back with us, Mr. Hauser. Quail is startled to be recognized -- particularly by this name.  He tries to stay casual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to be back. (pick up pen) I'm flattered you remember me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of my job, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember my first name, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles.  Charles Hauser, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed. (now he signs) Listen.  I need transportation to the... uh... the Sphinx. Can you arrange it for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir.  But Earth government has sealed off the excavation site completely. No one but survey teams and archaeologists are allowed closer than twenty miles. The Clerk taps a few keys on a computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... (spots something on the computer) Do you want the item you left with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What item?  Oh... yes, please. The Clerk turns to the safe, retrieves an envelope. He hands it -- and an ELECTRONIC ROOM KEY -- to Quail. 58      P.O.V. - THROUGH BINOCULARS - THE SPHINX Far in the distance, a dusty red structure squats amid barren dunes.  We see vehicles, scaffolding, a fortified perimeter. 59      INT. QUAIL'S HOTEL ROOM - DAY Quail stands at the window, looking through binoculars. He lowers them irritably, tosses them on the bed. Quail tugs the envelope from his pocket, tears it open. Inside is a single slip of paper, on which is written in longhand:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT. MARS HILTON - SUNSET It is now sunset on Mars and it's literally of inearthly beauty.  The sun is bold and blood red;  the foggy, drip- ping glass of the Dome tints the light into strange colors. Quail emerges from the hotel, properly attired now in a white tropical suit, and starts for the taxi stand. Behind him, also emerging from the hotel, is the Shoeshine Boy.  He keeps out of sight -- but is definitely tailing Quail. As Quail nears the first solar-powered taxi in line, he is approached by an amiable-looking CALYPSO GUY wearing a West Indian shirt and bright straw hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need a cab, boss mon? Quail hesitates, unsure of the protocol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine's right around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one's closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I out-hustle him, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Last Chance Air Station Kilometer 61   Gird Square T9" 60
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: exchange curses as Quail, wary, follows the Calypso Guy around a corner, climbs into the small solar car. 62      EXT. CITY DOME - AIR LOCK - SUNSET An AIR LOCK whooshes open underneath a Checker Cab sign. Bennie and Quail emerge in the solar-powered car -- set off into the desert. 63      EXT. DESERT - SUNSET The taxi traverses the same type desert that Quail crossed a few hours ago.  Only now is looks completely different. The late light tints everything in pastel shades, Quail is awed by the grandeur of the Lawrence-of-Arabia-like setting. 68      EXT. DESERT TRUCK STOP - NIGHT Quail and Bennie's taxi approaches a brightly-lit oasis in the middle of the desert.  There's a cafe, repair facilities and a huge parking lot -- all under a garish neon sign:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - EAT HERE AND GET GAS". Quail and Bennie's taxi pulls in and parks.  In the lot is a collection of strange and colorful vehicles:  huge ore trucks that pull eight trailers, mountain prospecting jeeps, Grapes-of-Wrath jalopies.  Quail and Bennie disembark, wear- ing breathing masks, and enter the main building. 69      INT. LAST CHANCE AIR STATION - NIGHT The joint is a combination saloon/cathouse/casino.  There are slot machines, HOOKERS, MINERS and HOMESTEADERS; it is like a Nevada brothel -- packed with wild and woolly indi- vidualists, the equivalent of Old West trappers, prospectors and cowboys -- but with a space-age look. Quail and Bennie elbow their way to the bar.  Fragments of conversation are overheard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...if that intergalactic little Napoleon thinks I'm sellin' and clearin' outta here, he can think again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...watcha gonna do when he cuts off the air, Luke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...you'll be breathin' red dust and shittin' bricks. Bennie and Quail pass another group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...my wife ain't goin' on one of those space shuttles... she hates flyin'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...aw, come on... flyin's safer'n crossin' the road...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...yeah, there ain't been a real disaster since that collision off Phobos, nigh on twenty years ago...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...well, that killed twelve thousand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this, Bennie... Tombstone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorta.  Bunch of miners out here got their own claims, from way back.  Cohaagen's buyin' em all up, says he's gonna cut off the air an' water if they won't sell... Quail attracts the attention of the BARTENDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for Melina Noel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've found her. His nod indicates an area behind Quail.  He turns to see an attractive waitress placing drinks on tables.  She doesn't notice Quail.  He walks toward her through the crowd.  Bennie watches, then tactfully slips away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to return to the bar and runs straight into Quail.  She stops, obviously astonished to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard! Almost in tears, she pushes her way through the crowd to a billiard room, which is separated from the main bar by swinging doors. There are no occupants and it is almost in darkness.  Quail, bewildered, follows her.  Inside the billiard room he turns on the lights which illuminates the area of the table. (NOTE:  As Quail and Melina speak, the activity in the outside bar can be seen above the swinging doors.) Melina is still fighting back tears.  Quail stops in front of her, unsure about what to do.  He has no recollection of how well he might have known this woman. Suddenly, she slaps him hard across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard... He rubs his painful cheek. MELINA (continuing) That's new -- the innocent look. (bitter sarcasm) You didn't have that one before. (beat) Well? Quail is speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, uh... I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I'll say it for you. He looks relieved (but tries to cover).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  I got the note. You discharged your obligation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What note?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, the usual one.  "Must return immediately to Earth... the wife needs me..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a wife.  Well, I do - but not a real wife. (getting desperate) Hell... look... someone else sent that note.  Someone who -- MELINA What are you here for?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For you!  I don't even know why -- Melina bursts into tears.  Quail rather tentatively puts his arms around her.  She welcomes this at first, but then pushes him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever I was, I must have been a helluva guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Whoever you were"???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen.  I've for to tell  you something.  I beg you to believe me... help me -- All Melina's suspicions come rushing back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something happened to my mind. Memory suppression, false implant, I don't know what -- Melina backs off.  Quail grows more desperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm saying is... I don't remember you.  I don't remember us.  I don't remember me -- Melina's expression grows dead hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [And I thought...]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Memory erasure is what they use on agents.  Go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait... I was an agent -- I'm not now -- just tell me who I am!  How did we know each other?  Why are they trying to kill me?! He takes a step toward her, nearly frantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not trusting you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You loved me once, you must have -- MELINA That you was a liar.  Who you are now I don't even know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Melina -- MELINA (tears starting) Get out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help -- MELINA (crying quietly) Get out!  Get the hell away from me! Quail gives up; goes through the doors and leaves.  Melina slumps her shoulder against the table and cries. 77      INT. LAST CHANCE AIR STATION GARAGE - NIGHT Quail enters from the cafe.  Bennie is kneeling beside his taxi, repairing a tire.  He look up, sees Quail approach. On his right hand, Bennie has a mechanical device capable of spinning 360 degrees.  He uses it to twirl a lug nut tight on his tire.  As Quail approaches, Bennie removes the TOOL ATTACHMENT from his HAND, tosses it into a kit beside the taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't look so good, boss. All over the Universe, women is an awful curse. He opens the door for Quail, beams. 80      INT. SOLAR-POWERED CAR - NIGHT - MOVING - DESERT BACKGROUND Quail still broods, Bennie tries to cheer him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a tough planet, boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some guy really screwed her - screwed her up real good. Some Earthman.  Just hopped on a space shuttle. Bennie bright tone isn't improving Quail's mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Bennie.  You're pretty well informed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that means I know it all, you're right, boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about the Sphinx?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know nothin'.  Not about the Sphinx.  That's out of the ball park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get there.  Can't you help me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No can do, mon.  You want women, cigarettes, red-market money, booze, even air or water... Bennie's your man. But the Sphinx... that's E.I.O. -- 80A     INT. CITY UNDER THE DOME - NIGHT The solar car is moving through the crowd, when suddenly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approach on a cross street.  Bennie brakes and stops. He and Quail watch as POLICE MOTORCYCLES clear a path for a huge, GAS-POWERED LIMO.  MINERS on the sidewalks shout
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... look at that one, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big cheese in town.  Big smelly cheese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cohaagen?  But isn't he often here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way.  That cat just cheat the Martian workers without ever leavin' his place in Beverly Hills.  Somethin' must be cookin'. Quail keeps his face in shadow and watches Cohaagen with curiosity as he passes.  Cohaagen is lit up briefly by a street lamp.  His face makes an impression on Quail, who perhaps faintly remembers him in the past. 82      INT. QUAIL'S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Quail enters, turns on the lights, locks the door.  He checks all the rooms.  Then he crosses to the dresser, studies himself in the mirror.  He looks haggard. Quail opens a drawer, takes out his "emergency case," sets it on top and opens it.  He removes a shoulder holster and pistol, sets them aside.  He takes out a tape recorder. He sets the recorder down gingerly, as if somewhere in there were contained the answers to all his questions. He's just about to activate it, when he hears a KNOCK at the door. Quail freezes.  Another KNOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hauser...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hauser, I want to talk to you... about Douglas Quail. Quail ditches the recorder and the "emergency case" into the drawer -- everything except the PISTOL. Quail approaches the door very cautiously (from the side -- out of the line of fire).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is George Edgemar. I work for Rekall, Incorporated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rekall??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  It's difficult to explain... Could you open the door, please?  I'm not armed. Quail opens it carefully, his gun at the ready, but out of view of the person at the door. A dignified-looking GENTLEMAN stands there, calm and pleasant, wearing an Earth-style business suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Quail.  May I come in?  I won't be offended if you prefer to keep the gun you're holding trained on me. He can't see the gun, but somehow knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right... come in. Quail does keep his gun trained on the man.  The man enters, holding in his outstretched hand -- a business card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My card, Mr. Quail. Quail frisks him, then takes the card, glances at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- so you're Doctor George Edgemar of 'Rekall, Inc.'  So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I said... this is going to be very difficult -- for both of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Quail... I'm afraid you're not really standing here at this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sat that again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, you're not really here.  Neither am I.  We're both in the Memory Studio -- in the offices of Rekall, Inc. On Earth. Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to tell me that this is all part of some... artificially injected fantasy? That I never really left Earth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not quite.  We didn't give you this.  You're creating it yourself -- (pauses, choosing his words) Remember the option we offered you?  Intelligence agent? Something inside you liked that idea, fastened on it. What you're experiencing now is a free-form delusion that you yourself are fabricating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this shit you're giving me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not -- shit, Mr. Quail. It's the truth. (beat) I know it's very hard for you to accept, but you're having a schizophrenic reaction... we can't snap you out of the Narkadine.  You're in a world of your own fantasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how the hell can you be in my dream -- if you know it's just a dream?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been artificially implanted -- like the first part of your fantasy.  I'm actually monitoring your dream at a psychoprobe console. This is a last resort.  When somebody gets stuck in their own fantasy, we send in someone after them.  A specialist, like myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe a word you're saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid you'd think that. I'm sorry to have to do this, but you really are stuck. (calls out) Doctor Noel, would you come in now please? The door starts to open.  Quail pivots and points his gun at the opening door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks in, carrying a CLIPBOARD.  She looks at Quail with professional detachment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Quail, I'm afraid it's all true. Quail is staggered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to break through to you earlier, but you just molded me into your fantasy. Sometimes it takes Dr. Edgemar to get through to a client as tough as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's supposed to happen now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do exactly as we tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somehow that doesn't appeal to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Mr. Quail... try to cooperate.  You're having a schizophrenic embolism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we can't get you out now... you may never come out of it. Your wife calls every day -- CLOSE - QUAIL Even more suspicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If this is a fantasy, there'll be no real consequences when I pull this trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there will by consequences inside your mind.  Consequences that won't hurt me... but could be fatal to you. (beat) If you shoot me, you'll wipe me out of your fantasy -- I can't come back again.  Because to you, I'll be dead.  I can't help you get back to reality. You'll be stuck in permanent psychosis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trembling, holding the gun point blank in Edgemar's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Showing no fear of tension whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to lower the gun, Mr. Quail.  You're going to hand it to me -- CLOSE - QUAIL Straining desperately to find the true "reality."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quail's finger on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to do exactly what I tell you -- Quail PULLS THE TRIGGER!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We SEE the results of the gunshot from this angle only, and so BRIEFLY as to produce an almost SUBLIMINAL effect: the back of Edgemar's head blows off -- He collapses to the floor. Melina LEAPS at Edgemar's falling form and CLAMPS HER HANDS over Edgemar's RIGHT HAND!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch out, Charles!  There's more of them in the hall! Quail spins toward the door just as it BURSTS OPEN.  A man enters, firing, but Quail has fallen to the floor and returns the fire.  He staggers back out into the corridor and slams against the wall, dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've had it, Hauser!  Throw out your weapon if you want a past! Melina is still crouched by Edgemar's body, holding his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for some reason.  Her CLIPBOARD dangles by her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an explosive in the clipboard!  He has a dead-man switch in his hand! Squeezing Edgemar's hand shut with one of hers, she holds up her other wrist -- to show that the CLIPBOARD IS BOUND TO HER WRIST BY A CHAIN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say, Hauser?  We haven't got all night!  Hauser? Quail (Hauser) SHOOTS OFF the chain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens it I come out? Quail takes the CLIPBOARD from Melina and eases himself to the side of the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll put in a word with the big boys.  Maybe you'll just get exile to Venus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  Here comes the weapon. Quail reaches around the corner and SAILS THE CLIPBOARD into the hallway.  Melina lets go of Edgemar's hand -- There is a TREMENDOUS EXPLOSION in the hallway, 83      INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT Quail comes out in crouch, ready to shoot.  On the floor lies a DEAD MAN and the body of the Shoeshine Boy, sprawled grotesquely.  The hallway is filled with smoke.  The floor covered with debris.  Plaster falling from the ceiling. All over the hotel, ALARMS begin BLARING. 84      INT. QUAIL'S ROOM - NIGHT Quail strides back in, icy-furious.  He seizes Melina by the wrist and drags her after him into the corridor. 84A     INT. CORRIDOR - NIGHT Two more E.I.O. men appear but Quail shoots them while dragging Melina down the hall in the opposite direction. He pushes open the door leading to the staircase. 84B     INT. STAIRCASE - NIGHT Quail and Melina run down the stairs.  On the next landing is a service elevator, from which a waiter is emerging carefully carrying a tray with hors d'oeuvres and champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in, quick!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't you prefer your order in your room, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In! Quail bundles the waiter unceremoniously back inside the elevator. 84C     INT. LIFT - NIGHT Quail presses the basement button.  As he talks to Melina he opens the champagne and pours two glasses.  The waiter is too frightened to protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Answers!  Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They kidnapped me.  Said they'd kill you if I didn't cooperate.  I told them I didn't care, but then when I realized they meant it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why they're after me, but what's your connection with all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were together before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I'm really sorry I can't recall the details of that encounter. The elevator has reached the basement.  They rush out. 85      EXT. ALLEY BEHIND HILTON - NIGHT Quail and Melina run from a basement door into an alley. A solar car whips out in front of them.  Quail and Melina leap aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go, Bennie, for God's sake! 86      INT. BENNIE'S SOLAR CAR - NIGHT Bennie weaves as fast as he can in and out of the traffic, Quail and Melina ducking out of view in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad news, boss lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black cruiser just pull out behind us. 86A     EXT. CITY STREET - NIGHT A large gas-powered official-looking car is pushing its way through the crowds and traffic behind them. 86B     INT. BENNIE'S CAR - NIGHT Quail is aiming his gun at the following car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the shooter, boss.  I lose 'em for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lose them?  In this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on! Bennie reaches down, grasps a KNOB.  He yanks it, like someone starting an outboard motor -- and an ear-splitting
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CLIPBOARD IS BOUND TO HER WRIST BY A CHAIN

direction.raw_text: roars to life. Bennie opens the throttle and the solar car HURTLES DOWN THE STREET.  Quail and Melina are thrown back in the seat. 87      EXT. STREETS - NIGHT GUNFIRE blazes all around the car.  Quail FIRES back at the pursuing car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna get a ticket for that engine, Bennie -- BENNIE Yutani 650 -- you like it, boss?  Nothing like the old gas when you want a bit of speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the cruiser rip through the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better have two aces, Bennie. (glances behind) There's a second cruiser -- and it's gaining -- 87A     EXT. CITY STREETS - NIGHT Bennie's car hurtles through the crowds with the official car gaining on it.  Bennie takes a corner sharply near a huge water selling stand.  The official car brakes to make the same turn, but clips the side of the water stand.  The water container tips and empties water through the open roof (i.e. through which one of the Agents has been firing) so that the car completely fills.  The driver continues the chase, but the occupants are now submerged.  They frantic- ally open the windows while continuing to follow Bennie's car. 88      EXT. ALLEY - NIGHT The solar car rushes down what appears to be a dead-end street, with the official vehicle (water pouring out of the windows) in pursuit. At the end of the street, however, Bennie doesn't stop but continues going into a large opening.  It is an abandoned mine.  The bigger car follows him, but won't fit.  The roof is smashed to pieces as the vehicle is wedged into the narrow opening. The second official car pulls up behind.  A chauffeur jumps out and opens the rear door.  Cohaagen steps out. result.heading: PISTOL IS SUCKED, CLATTERING, OUT THE VENT

direction.raw_text: speedometer:  22 MPH.  Every other gauge is overheating, flashing WARNING LIGHTS -- 124     INT. SPHINX CONTROL ROOM - DAY Cohaagen and a number of his associates, plus scientists and heavily arms troops are present.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The air supply is off under the domes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.  In a couple of hours it'll be all gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any trouble with the rabble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much, sir.  A lot of complaining.  But they're all heading towards the shuttle areas. On some of the video screens a number of space shuttles can be seen, ready for departure to Earth. 123     INT. TUNNEL BENEATH SPHINX The Mole bores through a sand wall, emerges into a cramped horizontal tunnel.  Quail and Melina leap out.  The poor Mole is smoking like an overheated drill bit.  Its nose is worn to a nub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got in with this thing, but we'll never get back out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shame.  Such a pleasant trip. There's a lighted area at the end of the tunnel.  Quail and Melina hurry toward it, moving silently, close to the wall. 126B    INT. MAIN DOWNSHAFT They draw up an abyss -- where their tunnel intersects the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Melina gasps at the colossal scale of the drilling, hundreds of yards across, deeper than the eye can see, and crisscrossed by catwalks, buttresses and super-sophisticated technology. Quail and Melina are forty feet below the upper end of the main downshaft.  They can look up the shaft and see the first interior level of the Sphinx itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the main tap -- straight down to the core of Mars.  When we trigger the mechanism, fusion reactors will detonate down there -- four hundred miles deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remind me not to slip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The new elements will come booming up through this shaft -- and six thousand others all around the planet. He's right at home -- and full of confidence. Quail climbs onto the ladder, which links various top levels. He starts to climb.  Melina follows him.  They are tiny figures.  The space around them plummets down to infinity. 127     INT. CORRIDOR AT TOP OF SHAFT - LOWEST MANNED LEVEL (LEVEL ONE) A patrol of NINE HEAVILY-ARMED GUARDS appear from a corridor in Level One -- directly above where Quail and Melina are climbing. 128     ON THE WALL OF THE SHAFT Quail and Melina's heads inch into view at floor level. They take one peek at these formidable warriors and duck back swiftly out of sight. 129     INT. TOP OF SHAFT - LOWEST MANNED LEVEL (LEVEL ONE) GUARD LEADER (to two of his men) Stay in contact.  I want to hear from this checkpoint every four minutes. Seven of the Guards move off, two remain in position. We HEAR the FOOTSTEPS of the seven guards recede. The two remaining guards realize their isolation; they glance tensely to one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over there. The First Guard points to the edge  of the main shaft -- right where Quail and Melina are hiding.  The Guards cock their weapons, start cautiously forward.  Just as they're about to peer over the brink, guns at the ready:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not there, boys.  I'm here. The guards spin around, weapons poised.  Standing in the shadows, near the corridor, is Quail!  (Still with no gun) Both guards walk quickly toward Quail, covering him with their weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch him.  He was EIO trained. They're all full of tricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Like...who was that guy? -- Fred Bond?? (to Quail) Keep 'em up, Fred, keep 'em up. Quail has his arms raised high.  Just as the Guards reach him, he fizzes electronically, emitting a humming sound, then disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hologram! Before either Guard can react, the real Quail appears -- one foot behind them.  With two LIGHTNING BLOWS, he dispatches the Guards.  (Apparently Quail has climbed out of the shaft while the Guards were distracted.) Quail snatches both Guards' weapons, grenades and ammo belts.  Melina climbs out of the shaft.  Quail tosses her one of the Guard's guns. 130     INT. CORRIDOR - LEVEL ONE ALARMS go off everywhere.  Quail -- carrying a gun and all the grenades and ammo belts -- and Melina (just carrying a gun) bolt down a corridor past a sign: "LEVEL ONE".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get that little trick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mail-order company.  It's a great one for fooling the wife. 131     INT. CONTROL ROOM (LEVEL THIRTEEN) Cohaagen and his Aides hear the ALARMS, see Quail and Melina on MONITORS as they race down the corridor on Level One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell did they get in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up the fusion core.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up the fusion core?? He exhibits begrudging admiration for Quail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're on Level One. A wall sign behind Cohaagen reads:  "LEVEL THIRTEEN".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seal all upper levels. A button is pressed and huge doors slide across in front of the formidable doors already closing the Control Room off from the outside corridors. 133     INT. LEVEL ONE CORRIDOR Quail and Melina are still racing through the corridors. He passes her a fresh ammo belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know how to use one of these? Melina expertly ejects her spent clip (that Guards fired at Quail), slams in a fresh clip and cocks the gun. Quail has a half-second to react, impressed, then -- FOUR GUARDS pound into view at the end of the corridor. Melina opens fire, nails two.  Quail heaves a grenade; as it EXPLODES, he and Melina bolt down a side corridor -- 134     INT. VARIOUS CORRIDORS, CATWALKS, STAIRS ALARMS continue as Quail and Melina dash down the side passageway.  MORE GUARDS cut them off;  Melina's machine gun sends them scattering -- Quail pauses at a corner.  He looks around quickly and sees that an elevator is arriving.  He motions Melina back.  The doors of the elevator begin to open.  Very quickly, Quail bobs his head and arm around the corner.  He calls out, loudly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Catch! He hurls something toward the armed men in the elevator. Instinctively one of them reaches for the thrown object. It is an explosive device of some sort.  Quail and Melina press themselves against the wall just around a corner from the elevator.  There is a tremendous explosion. Quail, followed by Melina, rounds a corner.  The elevator is in ruins; bodies are scattered everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great stuff, but how do we get up? She points toward the upper levels. 135     INT. CONTROL ROOM (LEVEL THIRTEEN) Melina and Quail can be seen on the security monitor from a high angle.  Quail looks up, spots the monitor, and shoots is to pieces.  The image on the screen goes black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget them.  We'll pick up Quail once the shuttles have left for Earth. 137     INT. CORRIDOR Quail spots a large WINDOWED AIR LOCK at the end of the corridor.  He and Melina race to it.  Quail starts to open the inner door of the air lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're afraid of the heights, you better get over it real quick. He is pulling Melina through the inner air lock door just as -- GUARDS stampede around the corner of the corridor toward them. Quail is out of sight, but they see Melina poised near the window.  She waves and smiles to them, hiding her gun behind her body.  They slow down and approach less cautiously, beguiled by her manner and attractiveness.  As they get close, she suddenly lifts her gun and opens fire, mowing them down. 140     EXT. SPHINX'S FACE - DAY Quail and Melina climb through the outer air lock door. They are at the Sphinx's shoulder, with a dizzying drop beneath them.  Melina looks down.  She's sorry she did: the fall is at least 200 feet.  (Both are wearing their breathing apparatus.) Quail and Melina start to climb.  Up the Sphinx's shoulder, along its Egyptian-like headdress -- 141     INT. CONTROL ROOM - DAY Cohaagen's chief aide, Emile, addresses him quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Quail's the only one who can operate all this... (gestures toward Sphinx's controls) ...then he can call all the shots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll tell him the computer's worked out the operational details so we don't really need him.  We're just doing him a favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if that doesn't work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We offer him rewards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if that doesn't work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll torture him.  You don't think I got this far by being a nice guy? 142     EXT. SPHINX'S FACE - DAY Quail and Melina traverse across the cheekbones, haul themselves up at the base of the red translucent eyes -- 142A    INT. CONTROL ROOM - DAY The video monitors show the space shuttles.  An operator, with earphones, turns to Cohaagen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First of the shuttles ready for departure, sir.  Two minute countdown. 142B    EXT. SPHINX - DAY Quail jams THREE GRENADES against the glass of the eyes, pulls Melina back behind the stone cheeks -- 143     INT. SPHINX CONTROL ROOM A MUFFLED EXPLOSION (due to the thin Martian atmosphere) detonates overhead.  THE SPHINX'S RIGHT EYE BLOWS IN a storm of shards and shrapnell. Instantly, the room turns into a hurricane as the Martian vacuum sucks out all air!  Everyone panics, grabbing their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seal the breach!  Repressurize! An aide dives for an EMERGENCY SWITCH.  But now -- Quail and Melina, wearing breather masks, bursts in onto an overhead catwalk.  They OPEN FIRE on the Guards, who are choking, struggling with their masks. An EMERGENCY PRESSURE SEAL powers into place, sealing the breach in the eye.  REPRESSURIZATION comes up, the internal atmosphere stabilizes -- None of the men inside the control room still moves.  The victors tug off their masks, spring down to the main level. Melina hurries to the main control panel. Melina looks towards the video monitors showing half a dozen huge space shuttles lined up for departure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those shuttles are starting up any minute.  If you know how to work this thing, you better do it now. Quail tentatively approaches the imposingly complex machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know how? Transfixed, mesmerized, Quail moves closer to the control panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... there's a vital connection missing... He approaches even closer.  He begins to raise his arm towards a blank area a little above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't wait!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you activate the mechanism you'll die...there were glimpses of it in your memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong, Cohaagen, there's a long tunnel, a brilliant white light, hands reaching for me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your death.  That's what it looks like.  That's what is always looks like. Quail looks around him, half-convinced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles - for Mars's sake.... Quail hesitates.  He looks from Melina to Cohaagen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not too late.  Join us again.  U've a lot to offer. A whole world. Quail continues to look at him, thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't deserve a new world, you and people like you made too big a mess of the old one. Time someone else had a chance. He turns back to the machine and slowly raises his arm again.  His fingers reach towards the blank section on the panel.  Slowly, through the panel, a luminous hand reaches toward Quail's fingers.  Gently, the fingers of the two hands touch. The entire control room begins to rumble and shudder.  As Quail reaches for Melina, Cohaagen suddenly dives on him. They grapple amid the shuddering Sphinx and can be seen only intermittently as debris crashes around them. The fight ends as Cohaagen is hurled backwards and disappears when a section of floor collapses underneath him. 144     INT. SURREAL TUNNEL A reprise of the sequence that opened the movie. Quail RUNS THROUGH A LABYRINTH OF TUNNELS.  THE GROUND HEAVES BENEATH HIM ... HUGE STONE BLOCKS CRASH DONW ON ALL SIDES!  We hear an EXPLOSION and ANOTHER and ANOTHER, each one SOUNDING CLOSER than the last -- Quail clamps him breathing mask on as he runs.  Is this his own death?  Where is Melina? The tunnel walls are just like the ones in Quail's original nightmare -- bright reddish-orange, clay and quartz. Quail throws a backward glance fearfully over his shoulder. The EXPLOSIONS are closer.  Suddenly -- Up ahead appears a BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT.  Quail sees it, but it only terrifies him more.  Is it death he's running to?  He hurries on with all his strength, but -- Just as he nears the white light, HE FALLS.  On his knees, too weak to move.  He struggles -- HANDS ARE REACHING OUT TO HIM, from out of the brilliant light.  Quail stretches for them, just as -- A FINAL EXPLOSION blows him forward -- straight into the
direction.name: direction
